qas.question: What is one university that was formed in the early 18th century of the empire?
What type of school was established in the empire in 1734?
In 1754 what man convinced the Grand Vizier to allow the use of the printing press?
Who was the Ottoaman Grand Vizier in 1726?
In what year did an Ottoman press produce its first book?

context: Educational and technological reforms came about, including the establishment of higher education institutions such as the <a0_0>Istanbul Technical University<a0_0/>. In 1734 <a1_0>an artillery school<a1_0/> was established to impart Western-style artillery methods, but the Islamic clergy successfully objected under the grounds of theodicy. In 1754 the artillery school was reopened on a semi-secret basis. In 1726, <a2_0>Ibrahim Muteferrika<a2_0/> convinced the Grand Vizier <a3_0>Nevşehirli Damat İbrahim Pasha<a3_0/>, the Grand Mufti, and the clergy on the efficiency of the printing press, and Muteferrika was later granted by Sultan Ahmed III permission to publish non-religious books (despite opposition from some calligraphers and religious leaders). Muteferrika's press published its first book in <a4_0>1729<a4_0/> and, by 1743, issued 17 works in 23 volumes, each having between 500 and 1,000 copies.
